availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Frederick H. Skinner (Eddyville, Kentucky, attorney and judge)

body.p: Eddyville, Kentucky, attorney and judge. Married to Helem M. Skinner. Father of Thomas Skinner, Isabella Skinner, Aurelia Skinner, Marian Skinner, Helen M. Skinner, Giles L. Skinner, and Hylan Skinner. Member of the Masonic Order in Kentucky at Suwanee Lodge # 2274, in Eddyville, in 1860. Presiding Judge of the Lyon County Court in 1860 and 1863. Owned ten enslaved persons and enslaved an additional ten, as agent for Hylan B. Lyon, in 1860.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, Eddyville, p. 98; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, p. 12; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, Eddyville, p. 10; Armonstrong, Amy, comp. Worldwide Masonic Directory, 1860 [database on-line]. Provo, UT, USA: Ancestry.com Operations Inc, 2001; KYR-0001-029-0529; KYR-0001-004-0057.
